main event: On December 30, 1957, witnesses reported seeing stationary elliptical silver lights in the sky over El Paso, Texas, during daylight hours.
interesting points: The first sighting reported an object resembling a star with a red tail, possibly a meteor, observed for 1 minute., Another sighting involved lights appearing elliptical in shape, lasting 20 to 30 minutes., A third observation described an elongated cigar-like object, approximately 100-150 feet long, seen traveling slowly and making a 180-degree turn., The sighting involved a total of 2 witnesses., The incident was concluded to be potentially natural phenomena by the reviewing officer.
witness description: Witnesses included civilians and military personnel.
